eu.focusnet.app.controller

Class FocusAppLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.focusnet.app.controller.FocusAppLogic

  • public class FocusAppLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This object is the entry point of the mail application logic. In the MVC paradygm, it would be the Controller.

    This class is a Singleton (the only one of the application). We only access static methods when it comes to access or alter the state of the currently running application, e.g. when we want to replace the current DataManager. Following this logic, the UI always acts on static methods (or accessed via getInstance()).

      The GSON object with which we do all our Java Object <-> JSON transformations

      Singleton instance
      private UserManager userManager
      Current UserManager for the application.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static FocusAppLogic getInstance()
        Singleton accessor
        Returns:
        A static reference to our Singleton.

      • getApplicationContext

        public static Context getApplicationContext()
        We need the context for some static method operations, such as ApplicationHelper.getSystemService(String)}.
        Returns:
        the current ApplicationContext

      • getGson

        public static com.google.gson.Gson getGson()
        Get the GSON object used for data conversion in our app.

        The GSON configuration never changes, so its safe to refer to it statically.

        Returns:
        a pointer to the GSON object, which is already properly configured for our application case.

      • getDataManager

        public static DataManager getDataManager()
        Get the current DataManager of the application.
        Returns:
        The current DataManager.

      • getUserManager

        public static UserManager getUserManager()
        Get the current UserManager of the application.
        Returns:
        The current UserManager.

      • getCurrentApplicationContent

        public static AppContentInstance getCurrentApplicationContent()
        Get the application content instance, i.e. the application content with all projects, pages and widgets and their content being initialized with proper values.
        Returns:
        An ApplicationInstance object reflecting the current content of the app

      • init

        public void init(Context context)
        Initialize app logic.
        Parameters:
        context - Current ApplicationContext.

      • acquireApplicationData

        public void acquireApplicationData()
                            throws FocusMissingResourceException
        Do the full login.

        Get the 3 basic objects (User, UserPreferences, AppContentTemplate), and then instantiate the Application content as a AppContentInstance, based on the Application template (AppContentTemplate).

        Throws:
        FocusMissingResourceException - If any of the involved resources could not be found.

      • sync

        public void sync()
          throws FocusMissingResourceException
        Data synchronization: we do a local copy of the whole initialization procedure and then register the reference of the new object as the current object in case of success.
        Throws:
        FocusMissingResourceException - if any error happens.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset whole app. This deletes everything that is locally stored.

        Note: this method called when crashing, so bugs in there won't be reportedby ACRA. Pay extra attention to it.
